snippet: The inmates escaped from six different halfway houses, including two run by Community Education Centers, a company that has close ties to Gov. Chris Christie.
abstract: Christie administration reports that six New Jersey halfway houses from which nine inmates escaped in recent months have been issued at total of $45,000 in fines; penalties are the harshest ever brought against the troubled network of private operators; two of the six halfway houses fined are run by Community Education Centers, company that dominates the system and that has drawn scrutiny because of its close ties to the governor.
lead_paragraph: The inmates escaped from six different halfway houses, including two run by Community Education Centers, a company that has close ties to Gov. Chris Christie.

headline.seo: New Jersey Fines Halfway Houses Over Inmate Escapes
headline.main: New Jersey Fines Halfway Houses $45,000 Over Escapes
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Fines Halfway Houses $45,000 Over Escapes
